intro: Heptapleurum kinabaluense, commonly known as the Bornean heptapleurum, is a flowering plant native to the montane forests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are small and white, often arranged in dense clusters. This species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
